title: How to Read Snapchat Messages Without the Other Person Knowing

steps.title: Understand how this process works.
steps.content: Understand how this process works. By opening Snapchat, allowing the messages to load, and then placing your phone in Airplane Mode, you'll be able to read the messages that someone sent you without them seeing that you opened the messages. You can then clear Snapchat's cache by deleting and reinstalling the app to prevent the other person from seeing that you read the message once you turn off Airplane Mode. [1] X Research source Since your messages are already loaded when you put your phone in Airplane Mode, it won't affect your ability to read the messages; however, Snapchat won't be able to send a "Read" notice to the other person's phone.

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat . Tap the Snapchat app icon, which resembles a white ghost on a yellow background. This will open the camera interface (Snapchat's main screen) if you're logged into Snapchat. If you aren't logged into Snapchat, tap LOG IN , enter your Snapchat username (or email address) and password, and tap LOG IN before proceeding.

steps.title: Open the "Chats" tab.
steps.content: Open the "Chats" tab. Swipe right on the main Snapchat screen to do so. This will bring up a list of recent messages, including the ones that you want to read without notifying their senders.

steps.title: Wait for the messages to load.
steps.content: Wait for the messages to load. Once you see "Tap to view" (or "Tap to chat" for text messages) near the messages that you want to open, you can proceed. If your messages aren't automatically loading, you should see "Tap to load" near the pertinent messages. You can tap once each message that has "Tap to load" near it in order to load the message.

steps.title: Place your phone in Airplane Mode.
steps.content: Place your phone in Airplane Mode. Swipe up from the bottom of the screen, then tap the white airplane-shaped icon in the resulting pop-up menu. [2] X Research source Tap the downward-facing arrow at the top of the screen to close the pop-up menu. If the Wi-Fi icon remains blue after enabling Airplane Mode, tap it to turn off Wi-Fi as well.

steps.title: Open a Snapchat message.
steps.content: Open a Snapchat message. Tap the red, purple, or blue (image, video, or chat) icon for the snap that you want to open. It should display as usual.

steps.title: Delete Snapchat from your iPhone.
steps.content: Delete Snapchat from your iPhone. Press the Home button to minimize Snapchat, then do the following: [3] X Research source Find the Snapchat app icon. Lightly tap and hold the Snapchat icon. Tap X in the top-left corner of the icon. Tap Delete when prompted.

steps.title: Turn off Airplane Mode.
steps.content: Turn off Airplane Mode. Swipe up from the bottom of the screen, tap the yellow airplane icon, and then tap the downward-facing arrow at the bottom of the screen. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Re-download Snapchat.
steps.content: Re-download Snapchat. You can do this by opening the App Store , searching for Snapchat in the Search section, and tapping the cloud-shaped "Download" icon to the right of the Snapchat app icon. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Log back into Snapchat.
steps.content: Log back into Snapchat. Open Snapchat , tap LOG IN , enter your username and password, and tap LOG IN . Once you're logged in, you should see the snap that you opened while in Airplane Mode appear as an unopened snap. At this point, you can open the snap to indicate that you've read it, or you can leave it alone indefinitely. The person who sent the snap won't have any indication that you've already read it while in Airplane Mode.

steps.title: Place your phone in Airplane Mode.
steps.content: Place your phone in Airplane Mode. Swipe down from the top of the screen (you may have to use two fingers to do this), then tap the airplane-shaped icon in the Quick Settings menu. [7] X Research source Tap anywhere not on the menu to close it. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Clear Snapchat's cache.
steps.content: Clear Snapchat's cache. While still in Airplane Mode, return to the App Drawer, then do the following: [9] X Research source Open Settings Tap Apps Tap Snapchat Tap STORAGE Tap CLEAR CACHE Tap CLEAR DATA , then tap DELETE when prompted.

steps.title: Turn off Airplane Mode.
steps.content: Turn off Airplane Mode. Re-open the Quick Settings menu, then tap the airplane icon to turn off Airplane Mode.
